pageContext.claim: “We've dramatically stepped up enforcement actions across the board, seizing more than 21,000 kilograms of heroin and nearly 8,000 kilograms of fentanyl since the beginning of 2017. And the biggest one was last week.”
pageContext.analysis: It’s not clear where Trump’s data comes from. Customs and Border Patrol reported it seized 13052 lbs (or 5920 kg) of heroin and 3956 lbs (or 1794 kg) of fentanyl between fiscal 2017 and fiscal 2019. That’s far below Trump’s assessment. Still, not all seizures happen at the border. A recent report by the nonpartisan Congressional Research Service reported 8000 kg of heroin were seized in 2017, but did not list any data for 2018 or 2019.
